info.description: Savings Plans are a pricing model that offer significant savings on AWS usage (for example, on Amazon EC2 instances). You commit to a consistent amount of usage, in USD per hour, for a term of 1 or 3 years, and receive a lower price for that usage. For more information, see the AWS Savings Plans User Guide.
info.title: AWS Savings Plans

clientToken.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

commitment.description: The hourly commitment, in USD. This is a value between 0.001 and 1 million. You cannot specify more than three digits after the decimal point.

purchaseTime.description: The time at which to purchase the Savings Plan, in UTC format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

upfrontPaymentAmount.description: The up-front payment amount. This is a whole number between 50 and 99 percent of the total value of the Savings Plan. This parameter is supported only if the payment option is Partial Upfront.

savingsPlanId.description: The ID of the Savings Plan.

post.description: Deletes the queued purchase for the specified Savings Plan.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve additional results, make another call with the returned token value.

nextToken.description: The token for the next page of results.

savingsPlanId.description: The ID of the Savings Plan.

post.description: Describes the specified Savings Plans rates.

nextToken.description: The token for the next page of results.

savingsPlanArns.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the Savings Plans.

savingsPlanIds.description: The IDs of the Savings Plans.

usageTypes.description: The usage details of the line item in the billing report.
